intro: Eleusine gouinii, commonly known as the African lovegrass, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typically wind-pollinated. Eleusine gouinii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. Its fibrous roots make it a valuable plant for soil stabilization and erosion control.
